items.title: Morning Brief Podcast: Brandalore Rising!
items.summary: Bengaluru is becoming India's new advertising hub, rivalling Mumbai and Delhi, driven by a mix of startups, digitally native brands, and independent firms.

items.title: Nvidia CEO: If I were a 20-year-old again today, this is the field I would focus on in college
items.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang believes that students should focus on the physical sciences if they were to start college today, emphasizing the importance of this field for future innovation in AI.

items.summary: Fed Governor Lisa Cook discusses how AI is set to reshape the labor market, with the Federal Reserve studying its impact and utilizing the technology for its own work.

items.title: Vaishnaw lauds Meghalaya village-level entrepreneur for leading grassroots digital empowerment

items.title: Wipro revenue drops 2.3% in June quarter
items.summary: Wipro's Q1 revenue declined by 2.3% in constant currency, attributed to muted demand caused by macro uncertainty. Clients are prioritizing cost optimization and AI initiatives, impacting the revenue.

items.title: 直近3年間に企業が実施したインタビュー調査「内部実施」は68.3％、「外部委託」は65.7％　インタビュー調査の満足度、外部委託は64.0％、内部実施は52.5％
items.summary: A recent survey by companies in the past 3 years found that 68.3% conducted internal interviews and 65.7% outsourced them. The satisfaction rate for outsourced interviews was 64.0% compared to 52.5% for internal interviews.

items.title: Has AI caused the jobs recession?
items.summary: AI has not caused the jobs recession, as young people have always struggled to find work during economic downturns. Youth unemployment has been high during various historical events, including the Great Depression, Seventies recession, and the 2008 financial crisis.
